full_sentence: My maternal great-great grandfather had a Spanish motto about the immigrants who began coming to the United States after the 1960s. In English it would be: 'Their stomachs are in America, but their hearts are in Mexico.' This does not sum up the attitudes of immigrants from most countries.

I don't know about you guys - but doesn't this disturb you? It feel like a design flaw in women actually -- like they're supposed to be so feminine and beautiful but little oversight is ruining everything. In my opinion I think women should be more aware of this flaw and it should affect their confidence.
